title: Inside the unsolved murder of Garrett Phillips
text:
Inside the unsolved murder of Garrett Phillips (Picture: Sky Crime)

Garrett Phillips was just 12-years-old when he was brutally murdered back in 2012.

However, despite the cause of his death being identified as both suffocation and strangulation, the murderer is still unknown to this day.

Almost eight whole years after the sixth-grader was killed, on October 24, 2011, his mother Tandy Cyrus is still seeking justice for what happened to her boy.

And now, Sky Crime is launching the new documentary Who Killed Garrett Phillips? in an attempt to shed more light on the devastating case.

The two-part series will focus on the trail of suspect Oral ‘Nick’ Hillary, who has since been proven innocent.

He was one of the few black men living in the small New York town, Potsdam, and almost immediately all fingers pointed at him.

Police grew suspicious of the the university football coach after finding out he had previously dated Tandy before splitting with her because he didn’t get on with her children.

Oral ‘Nick’ Hillary was a key suspect in the murder case (Picture: Sky Crime)

Tandy Cyrus is still seeking justice for what happened to her boy (Picture: Sky Crime)

This led to the father losing his job as well as being humiliated by his neighbours for five whole years before he was found not guilty back in 2016.

When he first met Tandy, the grieving mother was dating John Jones.

On the evening Garrett went missing, the youngster was spotted skateboarding at his school before making his way home.

Marissa Vogel and Sean Hall who were neighbours of the family said they heard a crash and a moan for help – which they’re convinced was said by a child.

They went onto phone the police at 5.08pm, who then arrived at Garret’s home shortly after.

Garrett Phillips was just 12-years-old when he was brutally murdered (Picture: Sky Crime)

John Jones was the other suspect (Picture: Sky Crime)

When they were unable to get into the apartment, they called a locksmith who let them in, where they found Garret before rushing him to hospital.

Just hours later, at 7:18pm, the schoolboy was pronounced dead.

While Tandy is convinced that Hillary committed the heinous crime, there is another suspect in the form of her other ex-partner John Jones.

It’s said she filed a formal complaint against her man back in January 23, 2011 – nine months before Garrett’s death.

However, it was Hillary that was indicted for murder in the second degree, seeing him spend 70 days in prison before he was released on bail.

The coach’s daughter Shanna-Kay Hillary testified for her father, and said he was in their house at the time of Garrett’s murder.

Yet, the suspect was indicted for a second time before he was found innocent by Judge Felix Catena.

Who Killed Garrett Phillips? comes to Sky Crime from October 20.
